DOC.HEAD: Tanks Sent To U.S. Embassy in Managua
With AM-US-Panama
DOC.TEXT: The Nicaraguan military stationed two tanks near the U.S. Embassy in Managua on Thursday after U.S. troops in Panama City surrounded the Nicaraguan and Cuban embassies, American officials said. The officials said the turrets of the Nicaraguan tanks were turned away from the Embassy, adding that there was no indication hostile action was contemplated. U.S. troops were sent to the Nicaraguan and Cuban embassies in Panama City after rumors spread that Gen. Manuel Antonio Noriega may have fled there during the U.S. military invasion. If the Nicaraguan tanks do nothing to disrupt embassy operations in Managua , ``there is not anything we would want to do to escalate'' the situation, said one official, who asked not to be identified. Otherwise, the administration will give ``deep consideration'' on how to respond, he said. U.S. diplomats told Nicaraguan authorities they saw no reason for the tank deployment, but the Nicaraguans said the deployment was in response to U.S. activities in Panama. The Americans replied that no hostilities were planned against the Sandinista embassy in Panama.
